lines.text: you fuck up once, you lose two teeth.
Hey, Sil. You remember your first blowjob?
Oh, yeah.
How long did it take for the guy to come?
Even a broken clock is right twice a day.
I wipe my ass with your feelings.
A wrong decision is better than indecision.
It's an idea, I don't know. Who knows where it fucking came from? Isaac Newton invented gravity because some asshole hit him with an apple.
You're late!
Well, at least I can always be on time tomorrow, but you'll be stupid forever.
[the dean of a college that Meadow is applying to is asking Tony for a $50,000 donation]
I think you should pay him, Tony.
No fucking way!
What, your daughter's future isn't worth 50,000 dollars?
That's not it. That motherfucker's full of shit. He's shaking me down.
No, he's not.
Oh, yeah? Who knows more about extortion, me or you?
Maybe I should tap into my roots, too. My grandmother was half Indian.
Get the fuck out of here.
No, it's true. She was in the Fakawee tribe.
Oh, yeah?
Yeah. When they used to get lost in the woods, they stopped and said "Where the Fakawee?"
[during the executive card game, Matthew Bevilaqua tries to clean up cheese from Silvo Dante, Silvio goes ballistic]
What the fuck are you doing?
Sil, take it easy.

[turns to Tony]
I'm losin' my balls over here! This fucking moron's playing "Hazel".
[turns back to Matthew]
Get the fuck out of here!
I was just trying to sweep the cheese away...
Why? Why now? Leave it there.
I don't know. I was just...
What?
[turns the other guys]
Where do you get these fuckin' idiots, huh? Where do you get them? He's sweeping the cheese, I'm trying to get...
[turns back to Matthew]

[shouts]
Leave the fucking cheese there, all right? I love fuckin' cheese at my feet! I stick motherfuckin' provolone in my socks at night, so they smell like your sister's crotch in the morning. Alright? Now leave the fucking cocksucking cheese where it is! Here, here, here.
[he swipes off the cheese on his plate onto the floor]
Go ahead. Have a good time.
Fear knocked on the door. Faith answered. There was no one there.
You're looking good. Looking better.
Tony, if you're gonna lie to me, tell me there's a broad in the car waiting to tongue my balls.
Hey, You want that, it's a phone call away.
Hey, Sil.
What?
"What". I've been gone a long time. Let me hear it.

[imitates Al Pacino]
Just when I thought I was out, THEY PULL ME BACK IN!
Log off, that "cookies" shit makes me nervous!
It's like taking a shit.
Ok. I actually like to think about it as a childbirth.
Trust me. It's like taking a shit.
Listen to me, the only reason I did this is because you're my nephew, and I love you. If it were anybody else, they would've gotten that intervention through the back of their fucking head.
[Christopher just got out of drug rehab]
So, what step are you at now?
I did all the steps, except for the one where I'm supposed to go around and apologize to all the people I fucked over when I was using.
...I think maybe you shouldn't do that one. You know, let sleeping dogs lie.
Yeah, that's what I was thinking.
It's hard to believe. My cousin in the old man's seat.
a good leader is benevolent and unconcerned with fame.
What?
"Sun-Tuh-Zoo". He's Chinese Prince prince Matchabelli.
Tzu, Tzu! Sun Tzu, you fucking ass-kiss!

You know where I was yesterday when you called?... I was outside a whorehouse, while a guy that works for me was inside beating the shit out of a guy that owes me money. Broke his arm. Put a bullet in his kneecap.
How'd that make you feel?
Wished it was me in there.
Giving the beating or taking it?
Sil, break it down for 'em. What two business have traditionally been recession-proof since time immemorial?
Certain aspects of show business and our thing.
[repeated line]
I wish the Lord would take me now.

[after finding A.J. was smoking weed on his confirmation]
Get back in there to your guests! Be a good Catholic for fifteen fucking minutes!
Are you still taking the lithium?
Lithium, Prozac. When's it gonna end?
We're trying to give a jolt to your system. Give it a... a little kick-start.
Why don't you kick me in the fuckin' head?
I know what you're going through must be painful.
This isn't painful. Getting shot is painful. Getting stabbed in the ribs is painful. This shit isn't painful. It's empty... dead.
I hate to do it, Artie. But I think I'm gonna pass.
Why not?
'Cause if you don't pay me back, I ain't gonna be able to hurt ya.
What do I find in a pork store? A bunch of guys beating their meat.
Let's get back to Pie-O-My, it's sad that you lost something you loved. That being said, it is a horse.
What the fuck's the matter with you?
You didn't go to hell. You went to purgatory, my friend.
[about his father]
The belt was his favorite child development tool.
[Christopher is stoned]

I called you here, 'cause I got something to tell you. From now on, I'm gonna rely on you more and more, 'cause you're the only one I can fully trust. Sil and Paulie... they're old friends, but you're one thing they're not.
What's that, T?
Blood. You're gonna lead this family into the 21st Century.
Well, Tony, technically we're already in the 21st Century...
[Tony looks at him, confused]
Forget about it. You won't regret this, T.

[to Silvio]
All due respect, you got no fuckin' idea what it's like to be Number One. Every decision you make affects every facet of every other fuckin' thing. It's too much to deal with almost. And in the end you're completely alone with it all.
Cunnilingus and psychiatry brought us to this.
If you can quote the rules, then you can obey them.
When you find him, I want him to suffer! You hear me, Sil? I want that mother fucker in agony!
Don't worry. We'll do the best we can.
The only thing I ever found in the street was my first wife.

[at the dinner table talking about AJ's behavior]
Oh his father was the same way. I practically LIVED in that vice principal's office.
Could we not?
Oh well you only remember what you want to remember. I must have had another son who stole a car when he was ten years old.
[pause]
Yeah, he could barely see over the steering wheel.
I would have to get a lawyer, find an apartment, arrange for child support.
You haven't been told.

[about his father]
He'd been in prison. He was away when I was a little kid. They told me he was in Montana, being a cowboy.
So, you won't talk about this to anybody?
I got the mouth of a statue, nigga.
[Three of Tony's capos enter a room angrily]
I thought I was the only one Junior could make look like that.
...and I know I'm the guy who's dating your mom,
Dating?
Don't get fuckin' filthy about it.
What do you have to be stressed about? That bar?
War, Christopher? The Middle East.
You don't listen to the president? We're gonna mop the floor with the whole fuckin' world. The whole world's gonna be under our control. So what are you worked up about?
Vito, you did tell the police you didn't know who did this, right?
Please. I may be distressed, but I know how to keep my mouth shut.
Unless there's a big tuna sandwich around!
They broke my fuckin' chair.

[as she's talking with Tony while sucking marrow out of a soup bone]
God, I love marrow, just like Ma. Remember Ma with a bone? It sounded like half-price day at a liposuction clinic.
We've had every one of Tony Soprano's phones bugged for four years, but the guy says less than Harpo Marx.
You got any idea what my life would be worth if certain people found out I checked into a laughing academy?
How much White Castle did you have?
I had none. I swear.
I can SMELL it.
[while playing hearts]
I've eaten more queens than Lancelot.
You're only as good as your last envelope.
[a union leader won't go along with one of the Sopranos' schemes. Bobby is sent to fix the situation]
How's it going? You're the head of the union aren't you?
Yeah, I am. Who are you?

Just a casual observer. You know, I've been following the situation, and I gotta tell you, it doesn't make much sense to me. I mean you recently got an offer, for a lot of money. And, if you don't get paid, you can't feed your family. I presume you got a family. I'm a family man myself, and I gotta tell you I'd rather take two shots to the back of the fucking head than not be able to feed my family.
[makes a gun with his hand and points it to the back of his own head]
One... Two... To the back of the head. You think about that.
The Soprano family has always been a little pushy.
Family? They're a glorified crew!
Whatever they are, Carmine, they make us a lot of money.
What fucking kind of human being am I, if my own mother wants me dead?
Is everyone in my life fuckin' bananas?
Oh, poor baby. What do you want, a Whitman's Sampler?
Where the fuck have you been? You're late!
Sorry, the highway was jammed with broken heroes on a last-chance power drive.
When you're married, you'll understand the importance of fresh produce!

[to a friend, about men]
Sure. You want someone who's sensitive to your needs, but still decisive enough for the occasional grope in the closet.
There are no scraps in my scrapbook.
Forget Coco, forget Fat Dom who goes over to Jersey and never comes back, forget my brother Billy.
My daughter got off on this feminist rant. She told me it's demeaning for a girl to be working at the Bing. The fact that these girls make $1500 a week has no bearing with my principessa.
What's yours is your Pauly, but what ain't, belongs to anybody else.
Oh, what do you know about what belongs to who? You been in prison for twenty years.
Which entitles me to earn!
Which entitles you to shit! In my book, you get points for staying out.
Then it's a good thing, Paulie, that your book doesn't mean oogatz to me!
Whatever you do, do not engage Silvio in conversation.
So, let's keep in touch. Call me when your grandson is born.
When he's born, I wouldn't want to be thinking about you.
In my thoughts, I use the technique of positive visualization.
I know you better than anybody, Tony, even your friends. Which is probably why you hate me.
The joint, not like in the old days. Fuckin' animals in there.
It's all about setting the precedent.
Phil treats nickels like manhole covers.
Look, maybe I am wrong, but you have really changed since the old man died. First, Lorraine Caluzzo. Then you sink this idiot's boat. This not the John I knew.
Rusty, I think he bangs his wife in installments.
End of story.
It wasn't like it was friggin' Cobain! It was just a little suicidal gesture, that's all.
We go way back to when Moses wore short pants.
To think, when I got out of the joint, I thought an airbag was Paulie Walnuts!
Ralph was asking if Tony was at the club. Why? Is he gonna be?
You don't know what this guy did for me.
Yeah I do.
Not just getting my stripes, something I can't talk about. Something that was ruining my whole life and he made it right. For what I owe him, I would follow that man into hell.
So, a prick says to another prick...

[to Tony]
See what happens when you swear at the dinner table?
[repeated line]
Get the fuck outta here!

[repeated punch line to a joke]
Since Moses wore short pants.
Chrissie, I hear you're doing good with the gambling.
You kidding me? With the money I made, I could go work at Denny's for the rest of my life.
Yeah, like they would ever hire you.
Junior Soprano's the new boss and he ain't respectin' old arrangements.
The fundamental question is, will I be as effective as a boss like my dad was? And I will be, even more so? But until I am, it's going to be hard to verify that I think I'll be more effective.

[Repeated line]
Skip the preambles...

[he's in denial over Pussy wearing a wire]
It's fuckin' JIMMY!
[repeated line]
don't bitch to me!
[repeated line]
It's okay. It's okay.
